values: i signed on to facebook and it's taking over my life.

check it: 
(i'm too lazy to do this any other way)

so deb i took some pictures for you so you can see our little house.  it might look bigger than it actually is.  i really think you should come visit edmonton... after all, your 3 favourite people live here, and next friday we're all going to be at the blue chair.  yaaaa pichu!

okay,






and this is pants, waiting for his breakfast.  he's pretty hungry, as you can see

is it wrong to begrudge other people their happiness?  and if so, after the bitterness sets in,  when does the remorse?  i see their happiness and while i am 10% actually happy for them, a good 65% of me is thinking "why you and not me?  why do i have to know the things i know?   what did i do wrong?"

that other 25% is a hazy mystery.  it's like califone says: "she's a loose tooth and she's a bare wire..."  that's right - you may have thought i was nothing but a naive and cheery optimist, but when it's all stripped away i'm a loose cannon.  i'm like a wildcat.

i have no idea where this post is going, or where it's coming from.  it's just here.

I'll be your man
I'll understand
And do my best
to take good care of you
Yes I will

You'll be my queen
I'll be your king
And I'll be your lover too
Yes I will 

Derry down green
Color of my dream
A dream that's daily coming true
I'll tell you

When day is through
I will come to you
And tell you of your many charms

And you'll look at me
with eyes that see
And melt into each other's arms

And so I come to be the one
who's always standing next to you

Reach out for me
So I can be the one
who's always reaching out for you
Yes I will, yes I will

You'll be my queen
I'll be you king
And I'll be your lover too

i went to see jason molina a while back and bought this giant t-shirt:





and this is what i did with it:
why the hell can't i post photos???  what am i doing wrong?
do you want to give me money?

sometimes i read the livejournals of people i don't know, that i find in livejournal communities.  is this how people get "livejournal friends"?  because mostly alli do is read the journal and try to figure out what kind of a person i'm reading about...   i get so fascinated  by reading about their lives and the way they react to things.   the one i found today is quite funny, in a sad sort of way.  very poor spelling and grammar, and seems to overreact to things.  likes to say things like "so ya..." and "im soo freeking tired, worn out, and feal crappy" and "if this continues im gona fucking backahdn her".   

i just found this part: "i dont care about spelling online, and could care less about spell cheque. so if you are a spelling natzi. you have been warned. "     hm, i guess i've been warned.  if i am indeed a spelling natzi.  which i may very well be.  

there's another journal that i read every few days, at first because it was a girl i sort of knew and it was wildly entertaining (how do people have such exciting lives, and i'm reduced to reading about them on livejournal) and now because she's almost inspiring in her ability to continue to have this entertaining life despite being bipolar, as well as documenting it so eloquently.  i really admire her, and i think she's a great writer, but i still feel weird about it.  i'm a stalker.  and even though i've heard that she likes to hear that people like reading her journal, i still feel strange about it.  

ahem.  in more "real life" news:  i might be getting some kind of promotion to a managerial position at the restaurant i work at.  it's this small local place that serves good food and has live music most nights.  i've just made enough mon-ay to apply for my bc teaching certificate, and i'm hoping to do some subbing here in the new year, which i'd be able to do 3 days a week while still working at the resto.  but i'm not sure if i'll be getting in over my head as the "manager" (that's how i'll always think of it, inside quotation marks) and if i'll be expected to be as singleminded as the bossman.  i hope not.    but we shall see.

hi y'all,

i thought you might enjoy a few photos of a cute boy.

in the car

in a chair

smiling at the girls

all dressed up

sleeping like a baby

i just made a no knit knit hat, a latshirt_bitchery   and it's amazing.  i used a grey argyle sweater.  man i wish i had my camera so i could show all y'all my mad sewing skillz.  that's it, everyone's getting hats for christmas this year...

1. DAYS
I work most evenings lately, so my days lay blank and empty before me while dave is away at school or work.  He's a baking machine and it seems I hardly ever see him.

1.1 Sewing
to fill the empty space and pour creativity somewhere i've been sewing.  projects so far:
- giant squid reconstructed black t-shirt
- puffy sleeved brown surf shirt
- "some kind of monster" metallica t-shirt made into a stylish and elegant black 3/4 sleeve shirt
- re-size of dave's thermal army shirt
- re-sleeve of another army shirt
- kimono-style top from grey "death before disco" sweatshirt
- brown "farmers do it in the fields" reconstruction
and the crowning glory:
tiny brown leather mocassins for my baby nephew colton.  i have plans for another pair in a larger size when his little feet grow and actually need shoes.  

1.2 Internet
i've also been spending a lot of time using the internet.  sometimes feels like wasted time, but then i can always convince myself i need to look something up before actually *doing* something.  like this:
www.livejournal.com/community/t_shirt_surgery  or this
www.livejournal.com/community/t_shirt_bitchery  or this
www.livejournal.com/community/clothes_surgery  or this
www.myspace.com/tamikolicious or even this 
www.livejournal.com/users/toomanytamikos  (obviously) and in my nostalgia i even look at this one
www.livejournal.com/community/victoria_bc  just because i miss it

1.3 Music
I haven't been spending any time practicing, studying, or performing any music.  the sewing has taken over my thoughts.  however, i will be going to see songs:ohia in 2 weeks in edmonton, and bonnie prince billy in vancouver in november.  

1.4 Weather
Weather doesn't *do* it for me...  but the cold has finally broken and it's sunny beautiful crisp fall, as it should be.  one thing to be said for edmonton (and alberta in general) weather - you definitely get the full spectrum of seasons.  no half-assed seasons for us albertans.  we go whole hog.  summer is summer and winter is WINTER.  hat season, here i come, when it's hat time of day all day every day.

1.5 Cooking/Domestic
Somehow i can't bring myself to do anything domestic.  but perhaps it's just because i'm getting over a cold.  today, however, i'm getting better.  plans to cook oyaku donburi tonight for dave.  he thinks i'm amazing when i cook japanese food.  

1.6 Post
I've been meaning to mail a package to manusha, but it just ain't happening yet, and she sent me a lovely little card yesterday.  guilt setting in, but post office so far away...  don't worry manusha!  i won't forget!! 

1.7 Baby
Colton!!  we went down to red deer (area) for the baby shower on the weekend.  my first "shower" experience, and it's strange.  everyone gathers round on sofas and chairs and chit-chats leading up to the big event... the person in the spotlight opens gifts everyone's brought.  and then the people go home.  but we stayed longer and hung out with eldon and sue and baby for the evening.  one could just sit and look at him, watch his frantic little arm and leg movements and his quivery chin all day.  i can understand how the floor could remain unswept, dishes in the sink, when one has a new baby.  it's all so exciting, so all-encompassing.  like you could fall down deep into the peace of his eyes and begin to see things the way he does, with the wonder of first sight.

i'm doing this:

Find your own pose!

winston is now back safe at home, being a fuzzer.  WHEW!  

AND!!! there's a new baby in the family.  david's sister Sue had her baby boy yesterday evening, 8lbs 10oz... he's a whopper!  she had to have a caesarean done, which i guess was for the best.  So yay for sue and baby!!

david: "i was doing this really hard work, mixing cement in a wheelbarrow with a shovel, and i was thinking about poetry..."


edit: a man just parked his truck across the street from my house and started putting a metal detector together.  treasure hunting?

so what's the deal with men and trucks?  

i had a job interview today and missed my bus, so i walked from bus stop to bus stop hoping to get there a little faster as i waited for the next bus.  while i walked, i noticed something about men in trucks:  they're bold.  a man in a truck will watch a woman as she walks by.  they generally do this in a way that is not hidden or sly or covert; they watch without looking away, until their necks are craned and they are posing a danger to the other motorists.  in addition to just watching, a man in a truck might also call out to the woman, or whistle at her, honk his horn or turn his music up extra loud, maybe even offer a little wave.  

at this point i have to ask that man, is this the best you've come up with?  what am i supposed to do with it?  are you really sitting up there in your truck thinking, "hey there's a pretty girl, maybe if i honk at her she'll like me..."

or perhaps the man does not have any agenda in mind, he is simply showing his appreciation, like the portuguese man sitting at the cafe on the corner who calls out "hey mamacita" to the pretty girls that walk by.  maybe the man does not have anything in mind and it's some kind of a reflex that is triggered by that feminine presence.  

And the funny thing about this situation is that it's nearly always men in trucks.  okay, sometimes the men are in cars, but women don't get heckled by men walking by on the sidewalk.  they don't get whistled at by cyclists.  the only other time men can be this bold and singleminded when they're not in trucks is when they are wearing hard-hats and fluorescent vests.  steel-toed boots and a tool pouch.  perhaps operating some kind of heavy machinery.  straightening up and leaning on the shovel to watch as she goes by.

last october my roommate from first year, Margaret, died of ovarian cancer.  i've been looking at her website and her friend karin's and it's sort of making me feel... petty.  

something about the vivacity in the entries these girls write/wrote is simply so amazing.  it's a life i can't even begin to identify with, and it makes me feel like all my lazy procrastinated and mediocre days aren't really the best use of my time.  

i just got back from san francisco yesterday afternoon.  before i left edmonton last week i was having a bit of a fit about my finances, and about how it felt like i had wasted my whole summer, since i didn't work and i keep having to borrow money from my parents.  but then as i got off the plane in san francisco, i realized that i really have had a rich summer.  i just didn't make any money.  

- i went to italy and boston
- i MOVED
- i spent a month out on the farm
- i went to san francisco

my summer was like a four month-long holiday... and all i can do is complain.  granted, it is a bit stressful not having any money and being in debt and starting over in a new province from nothing.  i keep getting these feelings like i should have just scrapped the whole 6-year university degree and opted for a two-year diploma that shoots me right out into the work force.  it's hard not to think like that.  but now, for what it's worth, i'm going to enjoy thinking about all the magnificent rolls of film i have yet to develop, all those images of sights i have seen.  they can be my production from the summer.  

oh, AND i rode the party bus.

i'm going to have to ask my parents to lend me some money.  wanna know why?  

a) I haven't  worked got paid for working since December

b) I have to start paying rent at my new place in Edmonton soon

c) I'm going on a reckless trip to San Fransisco

I hate the thought of asking them for money, especially since I'm going on that crazy trip, but I can't avoid either.  AND I can't start really working until I move to that place in Edmonton.  Which, by the way is excellent.   It's a little two bedroom house south of the river.  It's only a few blocks away from the trendiness of Whyte ave (not to mention the year-round farmers market), two blocks from the Mill Creek Ravine and all it's hiking/biking/treeish glory, and it's super easy to get to from out of town.  It has a little yard which David and I can fix up and plant however we want, hardwood floors, and walls that we can paint, and the landlord will even pay for the paint!  The kitchen and bathroom aren't that great, but we're planning on perhaps fixing up the atrocious flooring and sewing a curtain to hide the hot water heater (is that fire-safe?  i have no idea)  It's spacious, and the second bedroom will act as our sewing/computer/guest bedroom.  What a cool thing.  AND, since it's a whole house just for the two of us, there's no need to worry about such petty annoyances as shower water pressure.  I'm very excited.  I can't wait to start fixing it up.  Now all I need is some money in my pocket and I'll be set.

okay.  i think i'm okay now. 

still have no money and no job and no prospects, but i'm trying to find creative solutions to the money problem, and there's no way to work around the other two, so i'm working on just enjoying myself for these last two weeks.  yoga.  exercise.  pack.  see people.  play.  cook.  love.  plan.  search. 

it'll all work out.

been back for two days and am now experiencing intense, reasonless sadness.  any remotely sad or melancholy song will put tears in my eyes and being in public is painful.  i feel everyone's eyes on me and i just want to sink down into a corner and hide my face in my sleeve.  

i think it's because i'm finally home and i have to move in less than three weeks.  forever.  this isn't like all the other times, when i knew i'd be back in 4 months - this is my last victoria spring.  i'm trying to get ahead of the game with packing and cleaning, maybe just to have something to do, but these boxes and empty bookshelves are depressing.  so maybe that's what's creating this numb sad feeling that hangs around my shoulders all day.  maybe it's the rain?  the final break from all the excitement?  the fact that i have no job and no money and no prospects and nothing to do all day?  hmmmmm.

dear livejournal friends:

i'm home.

perhaps it seems like a short while since i last wrote, but i've been gone for 3 long weeks.  not that they were all hardship, since i was travelling around Italy, but there was a huge lack of communication available with david, which was hard.  also, i missed the kitties...  BUT i was in italy!  

i swam in the mediterranean sea and i think i'm in love.  

lots of vino was consumed, but apparently (please tell me if i have this wrong) the wine there has no sulphites, so you don't get a hangover.  why can't they have wine like that here?!?

late night and early morning low clouds
with a chance of fog
chance of showers into the afternoon
with variable high cloudiness
and gusty winds, gusty winds
at times around the corner of
Sunset and Alvorado
things are tough all over

when the thunder storms start
increasing over the southeast
and south central portions
of my apartment, I get upset
and a line of thunderstorms was
developing in the early morning
ahead of a slow moving coldfront

cold blooded

with tornado watches issued shortly
before noon Sunday, for the areas
including, the western region
of my mental health
and the northern portions of my
ability to deal rationally with my
disconcerted precarious emotional situation, 

it's cold out there
colder than a ticket taker's smile
at the Ivar Theatre, on a Saturday night
flash flood watches covered the
southern portion of my disposition

there was no severe weather well
into the afternoon, except for kind of a lone gust of
wind in the bedroom

in a high pressure zone, covering the eastern
portion of a small suburban community
with a 103 and millibar high pressure zone
and a weak pressure ridge extending from
my eyes down to my cheeks cause since
you left me baby
and put the vice grips on my mental health

well the extended outlook for an
indefinite period of time until you
come back to me baby is high tonight
low tomorrow, 
and precipitation is expected

it's been ages since i've sung something.  anything.  like really sung.  sang?  song?  suang?  

i used to listen to this song when i was working at the greenhouse in forestburg and i'd sing all out through the rows of alstromeria, a big bunch on my arm like i was a beauty queen in my dusty sandals and green stained t shirt.

"now you say you're lonely, you cried the long night through.  well you can cry me a river, cry me a river, i cried a river over you."

even though i felt like i was being taken advantage of and i was working a monkey job, thinking back, it was lovely.  get up in the morning in the gable room of joni's house that dave and i shared, do some chores, drive out to the meat shop to get a ride to the greenhouse... what i remember most of all was the warmth (it was warm in the greenhouse even when there was snow outside) and the light.  out there on that flat land there are no obstructions to the sunlight.  then after work i'd get another ride to the meat shop, pick up joni, sometimes go for ice cream or get the mail in town, and we'd head back out to the farm.  sometimes if it was really hot out we'd gather up dave and go back into town for a swim at the pool.  maybe cook a little dinner over the fire outside, go for a wagon ride with the ponies, and head back up to that gable room again.

Last night I went to see the C.R. Avery Band at Logan's.  Great show - and they've expanded Logan's so it's a heck of a lot nicer than it used to be.  The dance floor is now bare cement though, which is hard on the knees after a while.  They played the song I'm listening to right now, and it was much better last night.  It's like beer parlour gospel music and the whole bar is singing along in drunken harmonies somehow more free and real than sober ones.  Like That Feel by Tom Waits on Bone Machine... how it gets so wonderfully lush at the end.  and it's not tidy either.

I've been searching around looking for music and i stumbled upon the Blind Boys of Alabama site and it's like opening a wound.  I wanted so badly to see that show - and i just found out that they do a cover of a tom waits song.  I have to content myself with an internet video of one of their shows.  a bunch of seventy year old blind men singing gospel... *sigh*

going camping today, so i'm trying to bone up (what the hell does that mean?) on what kinds of things one should take camping.  very educational.

i had a terrible day at school (away from school) today.  the worst yet.  i have no reservations about calling it that.  i thought maybe i would make it through this hellish practicum without letting it make me cry, but no go.

bandfest today - we were at uvic all day and the kids were running wild.  i was at the same time trying to get them to act like humans (or at least be mindful of the humans surrounding us), and embarassed to be with them.  i was told by the bandfest organizers that their behaviour was far below the standards expected at bandfest and in the auditorium.  my students were being so chatty and loud that it was disrupting both the performers on stage and the recordings being made.  and the students who weren't in the auditorium were running around the university, chasing bunnies, having pinecone fights, and generally being annoying middle school kids, the type that nobody wants to have around. 

meanwhile, my sponsor and the other band teacher from my school were in the cafeteria talking.  

I took the heat. 
and  I had to apologize.

it was so bad.  the worst.

last night i played at a coffee house fundraiser at the ocean island backpacker place.  it was very... livingroomy.  and by livingroomy i mean small and cramped.  and there were all these people who were staying at the hostel trying to get to the kitchen.  quite strange.  the sound was pretty good - i thought i sounded good, and that's not always the case.  i played "yesterday's here" by tom waits and "a case of you" by joni mitchell.  dave was tired and wanted to leave soon after i played, but i had heard that the "UVIC IDOL" winner was going to perform at the end of the night and i was sort of intrigued.  i made dave stick around until she came on and it wasn't worth it.  she was totally into her new fame status - she kept saying that she was the headliner.  at a COFFEEHOUSE!  lame.  it was lamer than lame actually.  it was annoying.  i had to leave before she started playing her second song because the guy who was playing guitar for her (badly) was yelling into the microphone "Quiet!  i need quiet!  okay, one, two, three, SHAYNA!"

sheesh.  

i could do without these regular people who think they're rockstars.  

if you're lookin for a treat you all should check out this video

hike.  mt doug.  the tough road.  lots of "bouldering".  warm and sunny and spring-smelling.  pictures that i can't upload. 

spring is so exciting here.  well, i suppose it's exciting everywhere, but in victoria it seems to come all at once, and all the trees and daffodils and crocuses are blooming before you even realize.  it's lovely.  the sun is out making everything look its best and jim is in the back yard building a chicken run for our lone chicken.  today when we came home winston was on top of the small chicken enclosure the chicken usually stays in, and when we came closer to see we realized that there were two little birds stuck in the foot-tall pen.  winston was terrorizing them, and when we came over they started to freak out even more.  it's weird that they were in there though, and the chicken was off somewhere else doing her thing.

so. 

I  realize that the way i handled the situation in my class on friday was not the best.  I have to live with that and get past it and deal with any ramifications with those students on Tuesday when I face them all over again.  I also realize that there are better, more ideal situations in which i could have nurtured that student's independence and free thinking as an individual.  however, along with all those other important qualities that schools are supposed to be teaching, they also need to instill some kind of respect.  the boy in my class quite simply did not want to be in the class any more when he could be out wandering the halls.  when i refused to let him do that it created a power struggle and his reaction was created so that he would not lose face in front of his peers.  it was disrespectful, and i believe it was just him "testing" the student teacher, since my sponsor was out of the room at the time.  quite possibly i failed. 

in addition, it is damn hard to be in that school and even just do what i can to follow the norm.  it's much harder than it is to just talk about the way education should be.

i just got a facial.  i feel like kramer after he gets a massage from jerry's girlfriend and he's lying on the couch in his housecoat eating grapes.  "First, she puts on this new age music.  Then she lays you out on the table and rubs oil over every inch of your body."  it was lovely. my face feels positively supple.  they were alarmed at how my cheeks get red so easily. 

today in school a boy swore in my class.  he told me he was "sick" and he needed to go get his "medicine" in the middle of class.  i told him he could wait to the end.  he said something like "i'm just going to go then" and i was like "No- you're going to stay here until the end of class"  and he said "well this fuckin' sucks" and slumped back down in his chair.  it was a bit of a confrontation, and i guess i sort of made it into a power struggle.  then when my sponsor found out (he had been out of the room at the time) he stormed out to find the twerpy perp, and sent him to detention hall.  i have mixed feelings about this.  but now i sort of know what to do for next time. 

in my english class today i made the kids to grammar and sentence construction stuff.  mua ha ha ha!  serves them right, lousy comma splicers...

i got my period today, and it's been a while (well, a month actually) and i always forget what it's like.  i felt sorry for myself, so i prescribed a morning of bed, orange juice, warm wheat bag, and sudoku.  instead of my original plan: lesson planning all day.  however, i managed to get 2 of the 3 finished today, along with cleaning the toilet, changing the outside lightbulb, and various other mundane tasks. 

AND rachel came over today for dinner.  we made tacos and played labyrinth.  then we had tea and ice cream.  delicious.  a rather nice time... when i hang out with my girlfriends like that i'm always struck by the fact that i don't do it enough.  sad.  it's like, "THIS!  this is what i'm missing all the other times..."  girl talk!

i realize that i may not be making sense.  ahhhhhhhhhhh nina.  we've spent too long apart. 

okay friends, time for bed!

i'm sick again.  i'm sick of being sick!  it's sick!  and quickly sickening! if i could pick, i wouldn't be sick!!  ICK.

(how can you tell i'm about to do a poetry unit with my grade 9's)

i'm trying to find activities that all the students will be able to do with success, but aren't stupid and elementaryish.  no cinquains, no quatrains, no limericks!  no name poems, no object poems, no lame-ass adverb-adjective-noun poems!!

i will, however, do a pantoum.  mostly because i love the word pantoum.  and i have a beautiful example of one.

News, in brief:

1) i start my english unit next week (as in a few days from now).  i'm nervous and excited and frightened, but i know that my english sponsor is cool and funny and will support me and help me.  which is more than i can say for my music sponsor...

2) each day i grow more dissatisfied and disheartened with the way our working relationship goes.  and aside from his disorganization (which is turning out to be a major problem) i feel like the source of this badness is that he actually doesn't want to have a student teacher, and someone pulled strings for me to be at this school and had to twist his arm to do it.  very discouraging.  especially since the edmonton school district will be at the job fair on Feb 8th for interviews and they'll need to look at my evaluations, on which he only writes things that need improvement.  all these people will find out from the evaluations is what i can't do (which is a hell of a lot).  something inside my chest is sinking.

3) david's sister is pregnant, which is SO EXCITING!  i guess she's had scary complications in the past with pregnancies, but she's in her 2nd month, so it feels safer now.  AND she's due in august, which means that dave and i will be living in alberta when the baby comes!  i guess dave sort of feels one-upped because his little sister is having a baby before he is, but she also finished university before he did.  and her boyfriend bought a cool old tractor.  so they have a tractor, and a house before he does.  there's no way we can catch up... i guess we just have to be happy for them.  and i'm not budging on my timeline.

4) winston and pants are on the bed, grooming each other.  they have a progression.  sleeping separately - sleeping closer together - winston makes the purring asking sound - winston moves over to pants and starts licking his paws - pants begins licking winston's head - winston stops licking pants - pants starts biting winston - a fight ensues.
